page.title: 10DAIRY FARMING IN SUTTON VENY
page.content:
My Dad owns Long Ivor Farm . His brother and Dad help on the farm. There are seventy cows which are milked every morning at about 6 o'clock and in the afternoon at about 3 o'clock. Some of our cows have calves which are fed by their mothers for about three days, then they have powdered milk and are put into pens. then they have weaning cake and then hay. After about a month they go out to an orchard where they eat grass. When they are fat enough they are taken to market and are usually sold for beef.
We also have hens that lay eggs and they have to be collected every day. We own eight cats that catch the rats and mice that eat the corn that the cows eat.
